trees_changed_alert.text: We recently changed some trees and their species, as well as their location. Please be careful when searching by number (#x)!

login.heading: Your Project-Account
login.status_connection_insecure: You may not log in using an insecure connection
login.status_bad_credentials: Username and password were not recognized
login.status_expired: Your login expired, please log in again
login.status_force_credentials_confirm: Please confirm your password to access the requested page
login.status_not_authenticated: Please log in to view this page
login.status_insufficient_permissions: You are not allowed to access the requested page
login.description: Your personal project account enables you to enter phenology observations, access project-related news and much more.
login.disclaimer:
We don't store any personal data except those needed for scientific research clearly marked to be sent off for submission.
No automated E-Mails are sent out at any time to any user.
By logging in you agree to store your personal login information inside your browser.
login.reset_info:
Your new password must meet these requirements:
  • Contains at least 1 lowercase letter (a-z)
  • Contains at least 1 UPPERCASE letter (A-Z)
  • Contains at least 1 number (0-9)
  • Contains at least 1 symbol (!§$%&/()=?"'+#<>,..-*~)
  • Is at least 10 characters long
login.username_change_info:
Your new username must meet these requirements:
  • Is at least 5 characters long
  • Is different to your current username
  • Does not already exist
login.username_change_failed: Your username could not be changed
login.username_duplicate: The username you chose already exists
login.failed_attempts_info: Your account will be locked for 5 minutes after 10 failed login attempts.
login.change_password_failed: Your password could not be changed, check if your old password is correct
login.change_password_failed_nooldpw: Your password could not be changed, please contact an admin
login.otp_info: Please enter the two-factor code from your authenticator app.

otp_manage.qr_scan_info: Scan this QR-code using an Authenticator-App like Google Authenticator or FreeOTP.
otp_manage.recovery_codes_info: Make sure to store these recovery codes safely. If you lose access to your Authenticator-App, these allow you to log in. Each of the codes only works once.
otp_manage.activation_error_info: Code was incorrect, please try again
otp_manage.activation_connection_error_info: Could not reach server, please try again later
otp_manage.deactivation_error_info: Code was incorrect, please try again
otp_manage.deactivation_connection_error_info: Could not reach server, please try again later

summary.title: Information
summary.text:
„Urban Trees as climate messengers“: in this project researchers and students, experts and teachers from Austria, Germany and Hungary collaborate. By monitoring, measuring and modelling phenological phases and microclimate data, we aim to answer the following research questions: How do urban trees affect urban climate? How does urban climate influence the trees? How can these trees affect our future?

The following visualisations show selected aspects of this research.

through_year.title: Trees through the seasons
through_year.text: This image set shows the leaf development of trees in spring and illustrates a central research objective in the project: We investigate the length of the vegetation period of different types of urban trees and the influence of urban heat island intensity. City trees cool the city and make it liveable!

pictures_alt.1: Photo of tree taken on 18th of March. The tree has no leaves yet.
pictures_alt.2: Photo of tree taken on 21st of March.
pictures_alt.3: Photo of tree taken on 25th of March.
pictures_alt.4: Photo of tree taken on 27th of March.
pictures_alt.5: Photo of tree taken on 2nd of April. Many buds have already opened.
pictures_alt.6: Photo of tree taken on 5th of April. The tree has grown some larger leaves.
pictures_alt.7: Photo of tree taken on 8th of April. The tree has grown many larger leaves.
pictures_alt.8: Photo of tree taken on 11th of April. The tree crown now looks a lot more dense.
pictures_alt.9: Photo of tree taken on 14th of April. The tree crown looks even more dense.
pictures_alt.10: Photo of tree taken on 16th of April.
pictures_alt.11: Photo of tree taken on 20th of April.
pictures_alt.12: Photo of tree taken on 24th of April. The tree has fully developed its leaves.

cooling_power.title: Cooling capacity of our examined trees
cooling_power.text:
The highest measured cooling capacity of our observed trees was 5.3 °C.
To do that, we compared the temperatures of the reference-beacons in the sun to the beacons in the tree-crowns at each school, and looked at the differences between them.

leaf_development.title: Leaf Development
leaf_development.text: To illustrate the findings of our first year of observations, we have created a chart with audio commentary (only available in german). Press the Play-Button to start the commentary or press 'X' to see the chart.

details.status_invalid_settings: This beacon can currently not be read out, because incorrect configuration prevents readout.
details.status_initial: This beacon was newly deployed to this location. It has not yet been read out.

language.title: Language
language.desc: Choose which language to use for the entire site.

one_time_token.title: Your Permissions PIN
one_time_token.desc: This PIN can be entered on other people's accounts, so they get access to sharing phenology observations with you.
one_time_token.info: Can only be used once and becomes invalid when entered incorrectly.

account.title: Manage Account
account.desc_2: Change your username or password here or manage two-factor authentication.

support.title: Request Support
support.desc: Request help from - or report problems to - the project team.

delete_account.title: Delete Account
delete_account.desc: If you want to delete your account once and for all, you can do that here.

missing.title: Page not found
missing.desc: It seems you have been linked to a non-existent page. Use the links above to navigate.

beacons.title: Beacon Data
beacons.desc: Find single beacons and their data here.

beaconreadouts.title: Beacon Readouts
beaconreadouts.desc: Here you can see how often project participants read out our Bluetooth-Beacons every day. Every one of these readouts helps us a tremendous amount and is hugely appreciated!

phenologyobs.title: Phenology Observations
phenologyobs.desc: Here you can see how often project participants conducted a phenology observation. Every one of these observations takes about 10 minutes and helps us a lot!

data.title: What data is collected?
data.desc: The following things are currently registered with our system.

phenology.title: Phenology
phenology.desc: We regularly observe trees' buds and check whether they are open, half-open or still closed. This gives us very valuable data to compare trees between different locations.

imprint.title: Imprint
imprint.title_disclaimer: Some of the information below is only available in german
imprint.partners_coming_soon: The other project partners will be added soon.
imprint.os_projects_text: Following is a list of open source projects used to create this website.

home.title: Welcome to Cool Trees & Sensors!
home.desc: You can use this site to enter phenology data for trees, read information and statistics about trees and beacons and gain experience points for helping us collect data!
home.desc_user: More information on the project can be found on the start page. If you have any questions or suggestions, send us an e-mail at co2bs.ffg@sbg.ac.at. Have fun researching!

user_overview.desc_level_5+:
Wow, you've already earned {{xp}} XP!
Great job! Thank you for helping us collect all this information.
user_overview.desc_level_1-5:
You've earned {{xp}} XP!
Thank you so much for helping us collect more data!
user_overview.desc_level_0:
You have not yet earned any XP!
Consider contributing and earning XP by reading out beacons and submitting phenology observations.

phen_obs.title: Phenology Observation
phen_obs.desc: Enter a new phenology observation here. The five steps below can be completed in less than 5 minutes and give us valuable data about the selected tree.

step_2.title: When?
step_2.obs_past: Observation was done in the past

step_3.title: Observe the selected tree
step_3.no_obs_assoc: No observations are associated with the selected tree
step_3.undo_info_cursor: You can also undo by right-clicking.
step_3.undo_info_touch: You can also undo by long-pressing.

Bud.desc: Select {{type.objects.length}} random {{type_name_plural_lc}} from your tree. For each {{type_name_lc}}, click the image that most closely resembles it once.
Bud.name: bud

Leaf.desc:
Check whether your observed tree is
  1. completely green
  2. or started colouring and/or is losing the first leaves
  3. or is 50% coloured and/or has 50% lost leaves
  4. or is completely coloured or has no leaves
Click the image that fits the coloring of the tree.
Leaf.name: leaf

result.At least half coloured or lost: At least half coloured or lost

plural.At least half coloured or lost: At least half coloured or lost

report.title: What kind of problem do you need help with?

technical_problem.desc: This includes problems with beacon readout issues, the android app and the website.

other_problem.desc: This includes problems regarding how phenology observation is done, how manual beacon readout is done etc.
